title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
ingredients: 2 cloves garlic, peeled and left whole
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Boil spaghetti in salted water until al dente.
Cook pancetta in a pan until crispy.
Whisk eggs with parmesan cheese.
Mix pasta with pancetta, then remove from heat.
Quickly stir in egg mixture and season with pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, lemon juice, and spices for at least 1 hour.
Grill or broil chicken until cooked through.
Sauté onions, garlic, and ginger in oil until golden.
Add tomatoes and simmer for 15 minutes.
Stir in cream and cooked chicken, simmer for another 10 minutes.

title: Beef Stroganoff
summary: Tender beef strips in a creamy mushroom sauce, served with pasta or rice.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Cooked egg noodles or rice for serving
instructions: Sear beef strips in a hot pan until browned, then set aside.
Sauté onions and garlic in butter until softened.
Add mushrooms and cook until tender.
Sprinkle flour over the vegetables and cook for 1-2 minutes.
Gradually add beef broth, stirring constantly until the sauce thickens.
Return beef to the pan and simmer for 5 minutes.
Stir in sour cream and heat through without boiling.
Serve over cooked noodles or rice, garnished with parsley.

title: Ghana Jollof
summary: Tender beef strips in fish sauce, served with hot shito and tilapia.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Chopped vegetables (carrots, peas, bell peppers) - optional
instructions: Rinse rice under cold water until water runs clear, then drain.
Heat oil in a large pot and sauté onions, garlic, and ginger until fragrant.
Add crushed tomatoes and tomato paste, cook for 10-15 minutes until the sauce thickens.
Add chicken broth, thyme, curry powder, bay leaf, and Scotch bonnet peppers. Bring to a boil.
Stir in rice and reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 20-30 minutes until rice is cooked and liquid is absorbed.
Fluff rice with a fork and stir in chopped vegetables if using. Cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Remove bay leaf and Scotch bonnet peppers before serving.
